channel.title: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?
channel.description: Well after looking for a graphics card that would accommodate my rather crappy PSU, I found [url=http://www.geforce.com/hardware/desktop-gpus/geforce-8400-gs]this.[/url] Although it isn't the greatest card, on a budget will this be good enough to run a few games and perhaps help with video capturing/editing?

item.title: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?

item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Great. Thanks for the input Frell, this can be locked now

The rest of you were useless. Fuck y’all (jkily<333)

item.title: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?

item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Oh please, that’s not what I intended it for, I just wanted to text the results its more so intended for video editing and maybe being able to play some games without being windowed on lowest settings (TF2, portal, half life, etc).

item.source: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?

item.title: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Well I got the PNY GeForce 210 instead because I saw it and apparently it will work fine with my computer. Lets see how everything goes (just installed and I’m posting from my phone).

Edit: works wonderfully. Only tested for 5 minutes with Runescape, but there is no lag at all on high settings on fullscreen (granted I forgot bloom and antialiasing but whatever).

Read full topic
item.source: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?

item.title: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Well yea anything better then your current card will improve everything

Read full topic
item.source: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?

item.title: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:6, topic:459147”]Holy hell then your computer is small. My old computer was snug tight with a micro ATX mobo and it still even fits a 560ti which is 9 inches[/quote]Yeah, my computer is an HP Slimline model. My friend did give me his old case since he upgraded his, but the PCI slots don’t line up on the mobo and there isn’t anywhere for the power button to connect to. Plus, I can’t even use the psu he gave me since it doesn’t have some of the plugs I need for my board. It doesn’t bother me too much though, I’m just glad I found something that I can use without needing other parts for once.

The 8400 should help improve performance for video editing though, right? Because that is a large reason why I want it.

Read full topic
item.source: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?

item.title: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Holy hell then your computer is small. My old computer was snug tight with a micro ATX mobo and it still even fits a 560ti which is 9 inches

item.source: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?

item.title: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

I hope you know I only have an area that would accommodate a card that is ~7" long and 3" tall. The bracket of the 550 alone wouldn’t fit in my computer, I’d need a low-profile bracket already for the 8400.

Read full topic
item.source: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?

item.title: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

It should. I first got a 550 ti by mistake when I meant to get a 560 ti, the 550 ti was considerably smaller and my computer was around your size at the time. Hell even the 560 ti fit in it but it pushed some wires around.

550 ti should be fine if you want to max out decent games, and be able to at least playable bf3 etc

Read full topic
item.source: Should this graphics card be good enough for my needs?

http://www.hwcompare.com/9804/geforce-8400-gs-512mb-vs-geforce-gtx-550-ti/

That will last you pretty pretty pretty long[/quote]It looks like a good card, but there’s a slight problem with that.

This is my computer:

The GTX 550 will not fit in there.
